00029 import re, sys, glob
00030 
00031 print_tree = False
00032 debug = False
00033 end_node = None
00034 
00035 def DBG(hdr, s):
00036     '''
00037     Debug printf
00038 
00039     @details Print out an object preceeded by a string header if global "debug" is True.
00040 
00041     @param   hdr A header string.
00042     @param   s   Data to be displayed.
00043     '''
00044     global debug
00045     if debug:
00046         sys.stdout.write(hdr)
00047         print(s)
00048         
00049 class Node:
00050     '''A class of parse tree node.'''
00051     ## Supported token types.
00052     TOKENS = [ 'ROOT', 'END', 'KEYWORD', 'STRING', 'UINT', 'UINT64', 'INT',
00053                'INT64', 'HEX', 'HEX64', 'FLOAT', 'MACADDR', 'IPV4ADDR',
00054                'FILE', 'LIST' ]
00055 
00056     ## Token types and their corresponding C types.
00057     TYPES = { 'ROOT'       : None,
00058               'END'        : None,
00059               'KEYWORD'    : None,
00060               'STRING'     : 'char *',
00061               'UINT'       : 'uint32_t ',
00062               'UINT64'     : 'uint64_t ',
00063               'INT'        : 'int32_t ',
00064               'INT64'      : 'int64_t ',
00065               'HEX'        : 'uint32_t ',
00066               'HEX64'      : 'uint64_t ',
00067               'FLOAT'      : 'double ',
00068               'MACADDR'    : 'cparser_macaddr_t ',
00069               'IPV4ADDR'   : 'uint32_t ',
00070               'FILE'       : 'char *',
00071               'LIST'       : 'char *'
00072               }
00073     
00074     def __init__(self, node_type, param, desc, flags, list_kw=None):
00075         '''
00076         Constructor.
00077         '''
00078 
00079         ## Node type.
00080         self.type = node_type
00081         ## Parameter name.
00082         self.param = param
00083         ## Node description
00084         self.desc = ''
00085         if desc:
00086             self.desc = '    "%s",\n' % desc
00087         else:
00088             self.desc = '    NULL,\n'
00089         ## Flags
00090         self.flags = flags
00091         ## List of children nodes
00092         self.children = []
00093         if list_kw == None:
00094             self.list_kw = [] # used only for LIST tokens
00095         else:
00096             self.list_kw = list_kw
00097         
00098         # Cannot fill these out until we insert the node to the tree
00099         ## Reference to parent node
00100         self.parent = None
00101         ## Depth of the node
00102         self.depth = 0
00103         self.path = ''
00104         self.next = None
00105         return
00106 
00107     def add_child(self, child):
00108         '''
00109         Add a child node to a tree node.
00110 
00111         @param   child A Node object that is added to this node as its child.
00112 
00113         @return  The child node added.
00114         '''
00115         for c in self.children:
00116             if (c.type == child.type) and (c.param == child.param):
00117                 # The node already exists. Re-use the existing node.
00118                 # But check if the hidden flag should be cleared. If the new
00119                 # node does not have CPARSER_NODE_HIDDEN.
00120                 if 'CPARSER_NODE_HIDDEN' not in child.flags:
00121                     try:
00122                         c.delete('CPARSER_NODE_HIDDEN')
00123                     except:
00124                         pass
00125                 return c
00126         # Fill out some information that are tree structure dependent.
00127         # These information are actually embedded in the tree already
00128         # However, we compute them and cache them to reduce the
00129         # processing time later. This approach increases the storage
00130         # requirement but decreases the processing time.
00131         child.parent = self
00132         child.depth = self.depth + 1
00133         if child.is_list():
00134             # For LIST node, param is a dictionary.
00135             child.path = self.path + '_' + child.param
00136         elif child.is_param() or child.is_keyword():
00137             child.path = self.path + '_' + child.param.replace('-','_')
00138         elif 'END' == child.type:
00139             child.path = self.path + '_eol'
00140         elif 'ROOT' == child.type:
00141             # If we are adding a child ROOT node, the parent ('self' here)
00142             # must be an END node. For END node, we insert a string
00143             # 'cparser_glue' to the front of self.path. So, we must
00144             # remove it first before creating the submode root path
00145             child.path = self.param.replace('cparser_glue', '') + '_root'
00146         if len(self.children) > 0:
00147             self.children[-1].next = child
00148         
00149         # Insert the node into the children list
00150         self.children.append(child)
00151         return child
00152 
00153     def is_param(self):
00154         '''Is this node a parameter node.
00155 
00156         @return  True if it is a parameter node; False it is a keyword node.
00157         '''
00158         if (('ROOT' == self.type) or ('END' == self.type) or ('KEYWORD' == self.type)):
00159             return False
00160         return True
00161 
00162     def is_keyword(self):
00163         '''
00164         Is this node a keyword node.
00165 
00166         @return  True if it is a keyword node; False it is a parameter node.
00167         '''
00168         return ('KEYWORD' == self.type)
00169 
00170     def is_list(self):
00171         '''
00172         Is this node a LIST node.
00173 
00174         @return  True if it is a LIST node; False otherwise.
00175         '''
00176         return ('LIST' == self.type)
00177 
00178     def is_optional(self):
00179         '''
00180         Is this node an optional keyword / parameter.
00181 
00182         @return  True if it is optional; False otherwise.
00183         '''
00184         return (0 < (self.flags.count('CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_OPT_START') +
00185                      self.flags.count('CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_OPT_END') +
00186                      self.flags.count('CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_OPT_PARTIAL')))
00187 
00188     def __repr__(self):
00189         '''Representation method.
00190 
00191         @return  A string that describes the Node object.
00192         '''
00193         msg = ''
00194         if 'ROOT' == self.type:
00195             msg += '<ROOT'
00196         elif 'KEYWORD' == self.type:
00197             msg += '<KEYWORD:%s' % self.param
00198         elif 'END' == self.type:
00199             msg += '<END'
00200         elif 'LIST' == self.type:
00201             msg += '<LIST:%s:%s>' % (','.join(self.list_kw), self.param)
00202         else:
00203             msg += '<%s:%s' % (self.type, self.param)
00204         if len(self.flags) > 0:
00205             # Create a local copy and strip all CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_ prefix.
00206             tmp_list = self.flags[:]
00207             for n in range(0,len(tmp_list)):
00208                 tmp_list[n] = tmp_list[n].replace('CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_','')
00209             msg += str(tmp_list)
00210         msg += '> '
00211         return msg
00212 
00213     ## Display a summary of the node.
00214     def display(self, fout=sys.stdout):
00215         fout.write(self.__repr__())
00216 
00217     ##
00218     # \brief     Walk the tree
00219     #
00220     # \param     fn     Function to be called per node.
00221     # \param     mode   'pre-order', 'func', 'post-order'.
00222     # \param     cookie An opaque object to be passed into 'fn'.
00223     #
00224     # \return    Return the number of callback made.
00225     def walk(self, fn, mode, cookie):
00226         last = len(self.children)
00227         count = 0
00228         if (mode == 'pre-order') or (mode == 'func'):
00229             if ((mode == 'pre-order') or
00230                 ((self.type == 'END') and
00231                  (not self.flags.count('CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_OPT_PARTIAL')))):
00232                 fn(self, cookie)
00233                 count += 1
00234             for n in range(last):
00235                 count += self.children[n].walk(fn, mode, cookie)
00236         elif 'post-order' == mode:
00237             for n in range(last):
00238                 count += self.children[last-1-n].walk(fn, mode, cookie)
00239             fn(self, cookie)
00240             count += 1
00241         else:
00242             raise ValueError, 'Unknown walk mode: %s' % mode
00243         return count
00244     
00245     def c_struct(self):
00246         '''
00247         Generate the C structure name.
00248 
00249         @return  Return a string that contains the C structure for the node.
00250         '''
00251         msg = ''
00252         if 'LIST' == self.type:
00253             # For LIST token, build its nodes. First, build the variable name.
00254             list_kw_len = len(self.list_kw)
00255             for n in range(list_kw_len-1, -1, -1):
00256                 this_kw = self.list_kw[n]
00257                 if n == (list_kw_len - 1):
00258                     next = 'NULL' # last keyword in the list
00259                 else:
00260                     next = '&cparser_list_node%s_%s' % (self.path, self.list_kw[n+1].replace('-', '_'))
00261                 msg += 'cparser_list_node_t cparser_list_node%s_%s = {\n' % (self.path, this_kw.replace('-', '_'))
00262                 msg += '    %s,\n' % next
00263                 msg += '    "%s"\n' % this_kw
00264                 msg += ' };\n\n'
00265             
00266         if self.parent == None:
00267             msg += 'cparser_node_t cparser_root = {\n'
00268         else:
00269             msg += 'cparser_node_t cparser_node%s = {\n' % self.path
00270         # type
00271         msg += '    CPARSER_NODE_%s,\n' % self.type
00272         # flags
00273         if len(self.flags) == 0:
00274             msg += '    0,\n'
00275         else:
00276             msg += '    ' + ' | '.join(self.flags) + ',\n'
00277         # param
00278         if 'ROOT' == self.type:  msg += '    NULL,\n'
00279         elif 'END' == self.type: msg += '    %s,\n' % self.param
00280         elif 'KEYWORD' == self.type: msg += '    "%s",\n' % self.param
00281         elif 'LIST' == self.type:
00282             msg += '    &cparser_list_node%s_%s,\n' % (self.path, self.list_kw[0].replace('-', '_'))
00283         else: msg += '    "<%s:%s>",\n' % (self.type, self.param)
00284         # desc
00285         msg += self.desc
00286         # sibling
00287         if self.next:
00288             msg += '    &cparser_node%s,\n' % self.next.path
00289         else:
00290             msg += '    NULL,\n'
00291         # children
00292         if len(self.children) > 0:
00293             msg += '    &cparser_node%s\n' % self.children[0].path
00294         else:
00295             msg += '    NULL\n'
00296         msg += '};\n\n'
00297 
00298         return msg
00299 
00300     def walk_up_to_root(self):
00301         '''
00302         Return a list of Node objects that forms a path from root to this node.
00303 
00304         @return  A list of Node objects that forms a path from root (first elemnt) to this node (last element).
00305         '''
00306         assert self.type == 'END'
00307         p = []
00308         cur_node = self
00309         while cur_node.parent:
00310             p.insert(0, cur_node)
00311             cur_node = cur_node.parent
00312             if cur_node.type == 'ROOT':
00313                 break
00314         return p
00315 
00316     def action_fn(self):
00317         '''
00318         Generate the action function prototype.
00319 
00320         @return  The C action function prototype for a command.
00321         '''
00322         # Build a list of parse nodes that forms the path from the root.
00323         # to this end node
00324         path = self.walk_up_to_root()
00325 
00326         # Declare the action function
00327         msg = ('cparser_result_t %s(cparser_context_t *context' %
00328                self.param.replace('cparser_glue', 'cparser_cmd'))
00329 
00330         # Declare the variable list
00331         for n in path:
00332             if not n.is_param(): continue
00333             msg += ',\n    %s*%s_ptr' % (Node.TYPES[n.type], n.param)
00334         msg += ');\n'
00335         return msg
00336 
00337     def glue_fn(self):
00338         '''
00339         Generate the glue funtion.
00340         
00341         @return  The C glue function for a command.
00342         '''
00343         # Build a list of parse nodes that forms the path from the root.
00344         # to this end node
00345         path = self.walk_up_to_root()
00346 
00347         # Build the glue function
00348         msg =  'cparser_result_t\n'
00349         msg += '%s (cparser_t *parser)\n' % self.param
00350         msg += '{\n'
00351 
00352         # Declare the variable list
00353         skip = ''
00354         for n in path:
00355             if not n.is_param(): continue
00356             skip = '\n'
00357             val_type = Node.TYPES[n.type]
00358             msg += '    %s%s_val;\n' % (val_type, n.param)
00359             msg += '    %s*%s_ptr = NULL;\n' % (val_type, n.param)
00360         if skip: msg += '    cparser_result_t rc;\n'
00361         msg += skip
00362         
00363         # Extract the parameters
00364         k = -1
00365         for n in path:
00366             k = k + 1
00367             if not n.is_param(): continue
00368             msg += ('    rc = cparser_get_%s(&parser->tokens[%d], &%s_val);\n' %
00369                     (n.type.lower(), k, n.param))
00370             if n.is_optional():
00371                 msg += '    if (CPARSER_OK == rc) {\n'
00372                 msg += '        %s_ptr = &%s_val;\n' % (n.param, n.param)
00373                 msg += '    } else {\n'
00374                 msg += '        assert(%d > parser->token_tos);\n' % (k+1)
00375                 msg += '    }\n'
00376             else:
00377                 msg += '    assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);\n'
00378                 msg += '    %s_ptr = &%s_val;\n' % (n.param, n.param)
00379 
00380         # Call the user-provided action function
00381         msg += ('    %s(&parser->context' %
00382                 self.param.replace('cparser_glue', 'cparser_cmd'))
00383         for n in path:
00384             if n.is_param(): msg += ',\n        %s_ptr' % n.param
00385         msg += ');\n'
00386         msg += '    return CPARSER_OK;\n'
00387         msg += '}\n\n'
00388         return msg
00389 
00390 class Token:
00391     '''Token class. This class represents a token in a CLI command.'''
00392     ## Beginning of a parameter token
00393     BEGIN = '^<'
00394     ## End of a parameter token
00395     END = '>$'
00396     ## Token type
00397     TYPE = '([A-Z][A-Z0-9]*)'
00398     ## Keyword
00399     KW = '[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+'
00400     LIST_KW = '([^:]+)'
00401     ## Parameter name
00402     PARAM = '([a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)'
00403     ## Description of a node
00404     DESC= '(:(.+))*'
00405     
00406     @classmethod
00407     def valid_keyword(cls, s):
00408         '''Check whether a string is a valid keyword.
00409         
00410         @return  True if the string is a valid keyword; False otherwise.
00411         '''
00412         return bool(re.search('^' + cls.KW + '$', s))
00413         
00414     def __init__(self, s):
00415         '''Constructor.
00416         
00417         @param   s Token string.
00418         '''
00419 
00420         # Create the fields of this object
00421         ## Node type
00422         self.type = ''
00423         ## Parameter name
00424         self.param = ''
00425         ## Description of the node
00426         self.desc = ''
00427         ## If it is a LIST node, list of keywords.
00428         self.list_kw = []
00429         
00430         # Check if this is a keyword
00431         if Token.valid_keyword(s):
00432             self.type = 'KEYWORD'
00433             self.param = s
00434             self.desc = None
00435             self.list_kw = []
00436             return None
00437         
00438         # This token must be a parameter of some kind. Parse the type.
00439         m = re.search(Token.BEGIN + Token.TYPE + ':(.+)' + Token.END,  s)
00440         if not m:
00441             raise ValueError, 'Invalid token "%s".' % s
00442         if m.group(1) not in Node.TYPES:
00443             raise ValueError, 'Unknown token type "%s".' % m.group(1)
00444         self.type = m.group(1)
00445         
00446         # Check if it is a LIST type.
00447         if self.type == 'LIST':
00448             m = re.search(Token.BEGIN + Token.TYPE + ':' + Token.LIST_KW + ':' + 
00449                           Token.PARAM + Token.DESC + Token.END, s)
00450             if not m:
00451                 raise ValueError,  'Malformed LIST token "%s".' % s
00452             (self.type,  list_kw,  self.param, dummy, self.desc) = m.groups()
00453             # Validate all keywords in the list
00454             self.list_kw = list_kw.split(',')
00455             for kw in self.list_kw:
00456                 if not self.valid_keyword(kw):
00457                     raise ValueError,  'Invalid LIST keyword "%s".' % kw
00458             return None
00459         
00460         # Handle the rest of the parameters
00461         m = re.search(Token.BEGIN + Token.TYPE + ':' + Token.PARAM + Token.DESC + Token.END,  s)
00462         if not m:
00463             m = re.search(Token.BEGIN + Token.TYPE + ':([^:>]+)' + Token.DESC + Token.END,  s)
00464             assert m
00465             raise ValueError, 'Invalid parameter name "%s".' % m.group(2)
00466         (self.type, self.param, dummy, self.desc) = m.groups()
00467         self.list_kw = []
00468 
00469 ##
00470 # \brief     Add one line of CLI to the parse tree.
00471 #
00472 # \param     root     Root node of the parse tree.
00473 # \param     line     A line of command from a CLI file.
00474 # \param     comment  The comment that goes with this line of command.
00475 #
00476 # \return    Return a new root node.
00477 def add_cli(root, line, comment):
00478     global end_node
00479     nodes = []
00480     flags = []
00481     hidden_flag = []
00482     num_opt_start = 0
00483     num_opt_end = 0
00484 
00485     # Convert a line into a token list
00486     line = line.replace('\n','')
00487     DBG('\n  LINE: ', line)
00488     tokens = line.split(' ')
00489 
00490     # Delete all token that is ''
00491     cnt = tokens.count('')
00492     for k in range(0, cnt):
00493         tokens.remove('')
00494     if len(tokens) == 0:
00495         return root # this is a blank line. quit
00496 
00497     # If the '+' marker is with the first token, separate them
00498     if tokens[0] == '+':
00499         tokens.pop(0)
00500         hidden_flag = [ 'CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_HIDDEN', ]
00501     elif tokens[0][0] == '+':
00502         tokens[0] = tokens[0][1:]
00503         hidden_flag = [ 'CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_HIDDEN', ]
00504 
00505     # Convert tokens to parse tree nodes. '{' and '}' do not produce tree
00506     # nodes. But they do affect the flags used in some nodes.
00507     start_flag = False
00508     for t in tokens:
00509         # Parse each token
00510         # Look for '{'
00511         if '{' == t:
00512             # In the last node, its flags field is a reference to
00513             # 'flags'. So, if we append to it, the last node will get
00514             # a new flag.
00515             start_flag = True
00516             num_opt_start = num_opt_start + 1
00517             continue 
00518         # Look for '}'
00519         if '}' == t:
00520             # See comment in '{' case.
00521             assert(len(nodes) > 0)
00522             nodes[-1].flags.append('CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_OPT_END')
00523             num_opt_end = num_opt_end + 1
00524             if num_opt_end == num_opt_start:
00525                 nodes[-1].flags.remove('CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_OPT_PARTIAL')
00526             continue
00527 
00528         if num_opt_start > num_opt_end:
00529             flags = hidden_flag + ['CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_OPT_PARTIAL',]
00530         else:
00531             flags = hidden_flag[:]
00532 
00533         if start_flag:
00534             flags.append('CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_OPT_START')
00535 
00536         # Get the token type
00537         tt = Token(t)
00538         nodes.append(Node(tt.type, tt.param, tt.desc, flags[:], tt.list_kw))
00539         start_flag = False
00540 
00541     # hack alert - Check that if there are optional parameters, the format is ok
00542     
00543     DBG('TOKENS: ', tokens)
00544     if debug:
00545         sys.stdout.write(' NODES: ')
00546         for nn in nodes[:-1]:
00547             nn.display()
00548             sys.stdout.write('\n        ')
00549         nodes[-1].display()
00550         sys.stdout.write('\n')
00551 
00552     # We need to create the glue function name. Since the path of the node
00553     # is set up when the node is inserted, we don't have it here. So,
00554     # we manually walk all the nodes and generate the glue function name
00555     glue_fn = 'cparser_glue' + root.param
00556     for n in nodes:
00557         glue_fn = glue_fn + '_' + n.param.replace('-','_')
00558     
00559     # Insert them into the parse tree
00560     for k in range(0, num_opt_start+1):
00561         DBG('   CLI: ', k)
00562         num_braces = 0
00563         cur_node = root
00564         if num_opt_start == k:
00565             end_node = Node('END', glue_fn, comment, hidden_flag[:])
00566         else:
00567             end_node = Node('END', glue_fn, None, ['CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_OPT_PARTIAL',] + hidden_flag)
00568         for n in nodes:
00569             if n.flags.count('CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_OPT_START'):
00570                 if num_braces == k:
00571                     num_braces += 1
00572                     break
00573                 num_braces += 1
00574             if debug:
00575                 sys.stdout.write('        ')
00576                 cur_node.display()
00577                 sys.stdout.write('-> ')
00578                 n.display()
00579                 sys.stdout.write('\n')
00580             cur_node = cur_node.add_child(n)
00581         if debug:
00582             sys.stdout.write('        ')
00583             cur_node.display()
00584             sys.stdout.write('-> ')
00585             end_node.display()
00586             sys.stdout.write('\n')
00587         cur_node.add_child(end_node)
00588     return root
00589 
00590 ##
00591 # \brief     Process one .cli file. This includes handling all
00592 #            preprocessors directive.
00593 #
00594 def process_cli_file(filename, root, mode, labels, last_cli_root=None, last_cli_end=None, submode=False):
00595     '''
00596     Process one .cli file. This includes handling all preprocessors directive.
00597 
00598     @param     filename Name of the .cli file.
00599     @param     root     Root Node object of the parse tree.
00600     @param     mode     "compile", "preprocess" or "mkdep"
00601     @param     labels   A dictionary containing all defined labels used in
00602                         preprocessing.
00603     @param     last_cli_root The most recent root node created.
00604     @param     last_cli_end  The most recent end node visited.
00605     @param     submode  A boolean of whether we are in a submode.
00606 
00607     @return    Return the new root node.
00608     '''
00609     
00610     num_disable = 0
00611     label_stack = []
00612     deplist = []
00613     comment = None
00614     line = ''
00615     try:
00616         fin = open(filename, 'r')
00617     except:
00618         print 'Fail to open %s.' % filename
00619         sys.exit(-1)
00620         
00621     line_num = 0
00622     for line in fin:
00623         line_num = line_num + 1
00624 
00625         # Process the file line by line. The orderof processing
00626         # These different directives is extremely important. And the
00627         # order below is not arbitrary.
00628         #
00629         # We must process #endif not matter what. Otherwise, once
00630         # we start a #ifdef block that is omitted, we'll never be able
00631         # to terminate it. Then, we omit every other type of line as long
00632         # as there is at least one disable #ifdef left. Afterward, we
00633         # check for illegal directives. A normal command line is handled
00634         # last. Illegal tokens are checked inside add_cli().
00635 
00636         # #endif
00637         m = re.search('^#endif', line)
00638         if m:
00639             if len(label_stack) == 0:
00640                 print('%s:%d: Unmatched #ifdef/#ifndef' % (filename, line_num))
00641                 sys.exit(-1)
00642             num_disable = num_disable - label_stack.pop(0)[1]
00643             continue
00644         # Skip the rest of processing because some #ifdef/#ifndef is
00645         # keeping this line from being processed.
00646         if (num_disable > 0):
00647             continue
00648         # Check for illegal preprocessor directives
00649         if (re.search('^#', line) and
00650             (not re.search('^#ifdef(\S*\/\/.*)*', line) and
00651              not re.search('^#submode(\S*\/\/.*)*', line) and
00652              not re.search('^#endsubmode(\S*\/\/.*)*', line) and
00653              not re.search('^#include(\S*\/\/.*)*', line))):
00654             print('%s:%d: Unknown preprocessor directive.' % (filename, line_num))
00655             sys.exit(-1)
00656         # Comment
00657         m = re.search('^\s*\/\/\s*(.*)', line)
00658         if m:
00659             if 'compile' == mode:
00660                 comment = m.group(1)
00661             if 'preprocess' == mode:
00662                 sys.stdout.write(line)
00663             continue
00664         # #ifdef
00665         m = re.search('^#ifdef (.+)', line)
00666         if m:
00667             l = m.group(1)
00668             val = 0
00669             if not labels.has_key(l):
00670                 val = 1
00671                 num_disable = num_disable + 1
00672             label_stack.insert(0, [l, val])
00673             continue
00674         # #ifndef
00675         m = re.search('^#ifndef (.+)', line)
00676         if m:
00677             l = m.group(1)
00678             val = 0
00679             if labels.has_key(m.group(1)):
00680                 val = 1
00681                 num_disable = num_disable + 1
00682             label_stack.insert(0, [l, val])
00683             continue
00684         # #include
00685         m = re.search('^#include "(.+)"', line)
00686         if m:
00687             if len(glob.glob(m.group(1))) == 0:
00688                 print('%s:%d: file %s does not exist.' %
00689                       (filename, line_num, m.group(1)))
00690                 sys.exit(-1)
00691             if ('compile' == mode):
00692                 process_cli_file(m.group(1), root, mode, labels, last_cli_root, last_cli_end, submode)
00693             elif ('mkdep' == mode):
00694                 deplist.append(m.group(1))
00695             elif ('preprocess' == mode):
00696                 process_cli_file(m.group(1), root, mode, labels, last_cli_root, last_cli_end, submode)
00697             else:
00698                 print('%s:%d: unknown mode %s' % (filename, line_num, mode))
00699             continue
00700         # #submode
00701         m = re.search('^#submode "(.+)"', line)
00702         if m:
00703             if submode:
00704                 print('%s:%d: nested submode is invalid.' % (filename, line_num))
00705             else:
00706                 submode = True
00707                 last_cli_root = Node('ROOT', '_' + m.group(1),
00708                                      'Root of submode %s' % m.group(1), [])
00709                 last_cli_end.add_child(last_cli_root)
00710             continue
00711         # #endsubmode
00712         m = re.search('^#endsubmode', line)
00713         if m:
00714             if not submode:
00715                 print('%s:%d: #endsubmode without a #submode.' %
00716                       (filename, line_num))
00717                 sys.exit(-1)
00718             else:
00719                 submode = False
00720                 last_cli_root = None
00721                 last_cli_end = None
00722             continue
00723         # What survive must be either an empty line or a command
00724         if ('compile' == mode):
00725             try:
00726                 if not submode:
00727                     root = add_cli(root, line, comment)
00728                     last_cli_end = end_node
00729                 else:
00730                     last_cli_root = add_cli(last_cli_root, line, comment)
00731             except ValueError, msg:
00732                 print('%s:%d: %s' % (filename, line_num, msg))
00733                 sys.exit(-1)
00734         elif ('preprocess' == mode):
00735             sys.stdout.write(line)
00736         comment = None
00737     if 'mkdep' == mode:
00738         sys.stdout.write('%s:' % filename)
00739         for d in deplist: sys.stdout.write(' %s' % d)
00740         sys.stdout.write('\n')
00741     return root
00742 
00743 def walker_gen_dbg(node, fout):
00744     '''
00745     Display each node.
00746 
00747     @param       node A Node object.
00748     @param       fout An output file object.
00749     '''
00750     fout.write('  ' * node.depth)
00751     node.display()
00752     fout.write('\n')
00753 
00754 def main():
00755     '''Program entry point.'''
00756     filelist = []
00757     labels = {}
00758     mode = 'compile'
00759     out_dir = '.'
00760     c_fname = 'cparser_tree.c'
00761     h_fname = 'cparser_tree.h'
00762     # Parse input arguments
00763     sys.argv.pop(0) # remove mk_parser.py itself
00764     while (len(sys.argv) > 0):
00765         item = sys.argv.pop(0)
00766         if '-MM' == item:
00767             mode = 'mkdep'
00768         elif '-P' == item:
00769             mode = 'preprocess'
00770         elif '-D' == item:
00771             l = sys.argv.pop(0)
00772             labels[l] = 0;
00773         elif '-o' == item:
00774             out_dir = sys.argv.pop(0)
00775         elif '-c' == item:
00776             c_fname = sys.argv.pop(0)
00777         elif '-i' == item:
00778             h_fname = sys.argv.pop(0)
00779         else:
00780             filelist.append(item)
00781 
00782     # Process each file
00783     root = Node('ROOT', '', 'Root node of the parser tree', [])
00784     for f in filelist:
00785         if ('mkdep' != mode):
00786             print('Processing %s...' % f)
00787         root = process_cli_file(f, root, mode, labels)
00788     if print_tree:
00789         root.walk(walker_gen_dbg, 'pre-order', sys.stdout)
00790 
00791     # Generate .c file that contains glue functions and parse tree
00792     c_fname = out_dir + '/' + c_fname
00793     try:
00794         fout = open(c_fname, 'w')
00795     except:
00796         print 'Fail to open %s.' % c_fname
00797         sys.exit(-1)
00798     fout.write('/*----------------------------------------------------------------------\n' +
00799                ' * This file is generated by mk_parser.py.\n' + 
00800                ' *----------------------------------------------------------------------*/\n' +
00801                '#include <assert.h>\n' +
00802                '#include <stdint.h>\n' +
00803                '#include <stdio.h>\n' +
00804                '#include "cparser.h"\n' +
00805                '#include "cparser_priv.h"\n' +
00806                '#include "cparser_token.h"\n' +
00807                '#include "cparser_tree.h"\n\n')    
00808     n_cmds = root.walk(lambda n,f: f.write(n.glue_fn()), 'func', fout)
00809     n_nodes = root.walk(lambda n,f: f.write(n.c_struct()), 'post-order', fout)
00810     fout.close()
00811 
00812     h_fname = out_dir + '/' + h_fname
00813     try:
00814         fout = open(h_fname, 'w')
00815     except:
00816         print 'Fail to open %s.' % h_fname
00817         sys.exit(-1)
00818     fout.write('/*----------------------------------------------------------------------\n' +
00819                ' * This file is generated by mk_parser.py.\n' +
00820                ' *----------------------------------------------------------------------*/\n' +
00821                '#ifndef __CPARSER_TREE_H__\n' +
00822                '#define __CPARSER_TREE_H__\n\n' +
00823                '#ifdef __cplusplus\n' +
00824                'extern "C" {\n' +
00825                '#endif /* __cplusplus */\n\n' +
00826                'extern cparser_node_t cparser_root;\n\n')
00827     root.walk(lambda n,f: f.write(n.action_fn()), 'func', fout)
00828     fout.write('\n#ifdef __cplusplus\n' +
00829                '}\n' +
00830                '#endif /* __cplusplus */\n' +
00831                '\n#endif /* __CPARSER_TREE_H__ */\n')
00832     fout.close()
00833 
00834     # Print out a summary
00835     print '%d commands.' % n_cmds
00836     print '%d parse tree nodes (%d bytes).' % (n_nodes, n_nodes * 24)
00837 
00838     return
00839 
00840 # Entry point of the script
00841 if __name__ == '__main__':
00842     main()
